page.title: 12EDUCATION AND RECREATION
page.content: The bulk of the school population is found in the residential area to the west. Within the block there are 2 schools serving the primary age group. Coppice Junior School, built in the 1930's and extended in the 1960's, it has a school population of about 250 children from 7 to 11+. Yew Tree Primary school was built in the late 1970's. It has an infant - junior department of about 180 children. In the case of both schools the new residential area may increase it's school population. Children in the rural areas must travel to their nearest school. A large public recreation ground marked out for rugby union and soccer is situated close to the residential area. Three private sports grounds are located along Lugtrout Lane there is a cricket ground at Catherine de Barnes.
